meanings.definition: A person or thing that cedes or gives up something.
meanings.sent1: The ceder handed over the trophy to the winner.
meanings.sent2: The company acted as a ceder, transferring ownership of the land.
meanings.sent3: The ceder graciously passed the last slice of cake to their friend.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the pawn can be a strategic ceder of control over the board.
meanings.sent5: The ceder of the throne relinquished power to the new ruler.

meanings.definition: A type of tree that produces cones and has fragrant wood.
meanings.sent1: The ceder tree in the backyard provided shade on hot days.
meanings.sent2: The forest was filled with tall ceder trees swaying in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The ceder tree whispered secrets to the birds nesting in its branches.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the ceder wood filled the room with a pleasant scent.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter selected a sturdy ceder log for crafting a new table.

meanings.definition: A person who surrenders or yields to another.
meanings.sent1: The ceder accepted defeat with grace and dignity.
meanings.sent2: In negotiations, it is important to find a compromise without one party being the ceder.
meanings.sent3: The ceder waved a white flag, signaling their willingness to surrender.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes being the ceder in an argument can lead to finding common ground.
meanings.sent5: The ceder of the dispute decided to let go of their anger and move forward.
